org.cloudbus.cloudsim.brokers

Class DatacenterBrokerSimple

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.SimEntity
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.brokers.DatacenterBrokerSimple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, DatacenterBroker, Identificable, Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetDatacenterBroker, PowerDatacenterBroker

    public class DatacenterBrokerSimple
extends SimEntity
implements DatacenterBroker

    DatacentreBroker represents a broker acting on behalf of a user. It hides VM management, as vm creation, submission of cloudlets to VMs and destruction of VMs.

    This is a simple implementation that try to host the user's VM's at the first datacenter found. If there isn't capacity in that one, it will try the other ones.

    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo N. Calheiros, Anton Beloglazov

      • createCloudletsInVms

        protected void createCloudletsInVms()
        Try to create each submitted cloudlet inside a created VMs. If there isn't available VMs to host all cloudlets, the creation of some ones will be postponed.
        See Also:
        submitCloudletList(java.util.List)
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • selectNextCreatedVmToHostCloudlet

        protected int selectNextCreatedVmToHostCloudlet(int currentSelectedVm)
        Gets the index of the next Vm in the getVmsCreatedList() from the current selected Vm. The method deals the list of created VMs as a circular list, by this way, after it selects the last Vm, the next Vm will be the first one.
        Parameters:
        currentSelectedVm -
        Returns:
        the index of the selected Vm
